about.creativity_description: I believe the functioning of a page is as important as its aesthetics. Details and interactivity are my 2 pillars, which are more effective with the active kind of users who enjoy discovering microexperiences generated by movement.
about.logic_description: Architect with a strong base in system design and diagramming, eager to learn. Currently studying computer engineering along with courses to expand my knowledge in the world of programming.

experience.description: Indie videogame studio that has developed “Surviving the Humans”, a classic 2D point-and-click adventure. Currently involved in the development of a new 3D adventure game, I am part of the team working on this project.

roles.name: Environmental Designer
roles.description: I created the preliminary architecture design in Blender and material design in Quixel Mixer to explore the style that the game will have.

roles.name: Game Designer
roles.description: Along with the team, I developed the structure and pillars of the game based on the player's experience, the variables that define it, gameplay concepts and replayability.

roles.name: Basic BP Developer
roles.description: Using basic blueprint development (block programming in Unreal Engine), I designed mechanics on a prototyping level that were adapted to the culture on which the game is based, iterating on gameplay.

courses.name: #YoProgramo
courses.description: The first phase of the programming and computational thinking training program, offered by the government of Argentina. It covers the fundamentals of programming through the use of Gobstones, Java, and Ruby.

courses.name: #SeProgramar
courses.description: The second phase of the programming and computational thinking training program, offered by the government of Argentina. It covers different tools related to agile methodologies such as Scrum, and develops a full-stack profile through the creation of a portfolio. To carry out the project, participants deepen their knowledge in HTML and CSS, Angular, Java, MySQL, and Springboot.

courses.name: Diplomatura en Professional Front End Developer
courses.description: The training program covers the development of flexible and adaptable websites that can adjust to any screen size, use of JQuery libraries to add interactivity to websites without having to write all the code from scratch and fundamental knowledge of Javascript. The training emphasizes the use of semantic elements, optimized design techniques in website layout, as well as HTML5 and CSS3 usage.

courses.name: Responsive Web Design
courses.description: Basics of HTML and CSS through the development of 19 web pages and a personal portfolio, including modern techniques such as CSS variables and best practices for accessibility. Master responsive design with Flexbox and CSS Grid.

courses.name: Fundamentals
courses.description: Functions, creating variables, control code flow. This course uses JavaScript, but the concepts can be applied to any coding language.

courses.name: Fundamentals II
courses.description: Building on the knowledge you gained in Fundamentals; learn how to manipulate string and arrays, use alternative approaches to similar problems and create your own functions.

courses.name: Animations
courses.description: Create, manipulate, and animate shapes. This course uses the D3 library, Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG), and JavaScript.

courses.name: Animations II
courses.description: Create interactive, manipulatable animations. Use of Arrow functions.

courses.name: Array Methods
courses.description: Different ways to search arrays, combine elements, and transform elements using arrow functions.

courses.name: Automation
courses.description: Automate tasks using Apps Script, a Google product powered by JavaScript.

courses.name: Debugging Code
courses.description: Spot errors of different types and use coding tools such as try catch statements and the console for debugging.

courses.name: Intro to Webpages
courses.description: HTML, CSS, and how JavaScript can interact with them.

courses.name: 30 Days of Code
courses.description: Basic problem solving challenges, such as Conditional Statements, Class vs. Instante, Data Types, etc.. Earned 2 stars having solved the challenges that correspond to days 0-6.

courses.name: 10 Days of JS
courses.description: Basic problem solving challenges, such as Conditional Statements, Loops, Arrays, etc. Earned 3 stars having solved the challenges that correspond to days 0-3.

courses.name: Desarrollador Generalista de Unreal Engine 5
courses.description: Focuses on the stages of developing a level, including blockout, references, prototyping, asset libraries, composition, geometry, effects, and lighting. The course concludes with a final workshop in which students will apply all of the skills they have acquired to develop a game from start to finish, including design, prototyping, development, testing, and construction. The areas covered include UE5 interface and configuration, assets, levels, sub-levels, and actors, as well as the creation of a game and how to combine components, variables, and programming basic movements via Blueprints. Finally, physics, special effects, sound, music, and generating cinematics with Sequencer.

hard.name: Software knowledge
hard.description: I have a good proficiency in Excel programming, graphs and data analysis in Power BI.

hard.name: Agile methodologies
hard.description: The second stage of the course focuses on the SCRUM methodology through reading and development of Excel files to set up sprints, I am familiar with Codecks as well.

hard.name: UI design
hard.description: I have basic knowledge of Photoshop and intermediate skills in video editing tools, exemplified in the AI project in the 'Projects' section. Regarding 3D modeling, I have experience in Blender and Rhinoceros, having used the latter during my architecture degree to model different types of structures and generate architectural documentation.

hard.name: Database management
hard.description: Intermediate level of data handling in MySQL and graphical representation in Tableau, with experience using MySQL for academic studies and during the development of my current portfolio.

hard.name: Multilingual
hard.description: I have a high level of proficiency in English, intermediate proficiency in French, and basic proficiency in Russian. I strive to improve my language skills on a daily basis. I am particularly interested in the possibility of working for a foreign company.

soft.name: Willingness to learn
soft.description: One of the main characteristics that drive me to develop projects is my ambition and perfectionism. I dedicate most of my free time to reinterpreting web pages based on exercises found on the internet or creating my own exercises. I am very interested in learning about programming in general and I am open to all types of knowledge and perfecting specific tools.

soft.name: Teamwork
soft.description: As someone who values collaboration and teamwork, I understand the importance of taking initiative, being accountable, and supporting others. Even though I may not hold a formal leadership position, I still strive to make a positive impact by actively listening, effectively communicating, and helping my team stay motivated and focused.

projects.title: BeautyMorphosy
projects.description: BeautyMorphosy is the first project I developed in HTML and CSS in July of last year. I am very interested in things that change shape and evolve, which is why in several projects my content is oriented towards these insects and the cataloging of species. One of the biggest challenges was developing a paint program without JS, only using HTML and CSS selectors.

projects.title: freeCodeCamp Album
projects.description: The objective of this project is to compare the outcome of the original exercise provided by fCC (fCC style) and my personal approach based on this original exercise (My Style).

projects.title: Playground
projects.description: The first group of applications I developed using JavaScript is called that way because it consists of 3 very basic games. The first one is creating a birthday card, the second is a memory game, and the third is adopting a random fish.

projects.title: LPS Catalogue
projects.description: I used an old toy collection as an excuse to develop an inventory. As a collector of various objects, creating catalogue-type pages is one of the things I enjoy doing the most because it involves storing and filtering large amounts of data, as well as exposing it in a harmonious way. I took advantage of the excess information to create a questionnaire about the inventory information.

projects.title: Majesties
projects.description: The objective of this project is to compare the outcome of the original exercise provided by fCC (fCC style) and my personal approach based on this original exercise (My Style).

projects.title: Portfolio
projects.description: One of the most important aspects that I try to reflect in the content of my current project is the way I think and diagram. I enjoy developing dynamic content the most, where small details make the user more immersed in the webpage, responding to a reality that demands constantly updated content.

projects.title: Echinoderm Buildings
projects.description: Echinoderm Buildings reflects the transgression of buildings into transmuted structures. Sets of buildings and marine species are trained and the result of the merge, 'transmuted species', are evaluated by a python classifier. Will the monstrous transcanon trick the discriminator and conceive the Echinoderm Buildings as architecture?

projects.title: Orbzidyum
projects.description: Orbzidyum is a dark-adventure game where the character seeks to restore the ecosystems within the shell its trapped in. Each ecosystem holds a variety of species that can whether be killed or befriended, decisions that will forge a character and have an impact on future games to come. Orbzidyum is just the birth of Bridyam, world full of dark yet beautiful secrets.
